domino_project

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • domino_project.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the interaction between the user and the console.(Its not used for the GUI edition in the second part of the project).

        Asks for reverse of tile.
        Returns:

        public void createWhiteSpaces(int n)
        Creates n empty lines.
        Parameters:
        n - number of empty lines

      • readTileFromPanel

        public int readTileFromPanel()
        Reads an integer representing the row that a player wants to pick a Tile from. This carries on till valid input.
        Returns:
        the row of which the tile that the user chose will be played.

      • showInvalidInput

        public void showInvalidInput()
        Shows invalidInput to User.

      • giveChoice

        public static int giveChoice()
        This is a static method. Reads from user an integer representing the position(beggining or end) that they want to put the tile at(tile fits on beggining and at the end of this DominoLine).
        Returns:
        1 put tile ot the beggining of this DominoLine 2 put tile at the end of this DominoLine

      • readFromHand

        public int readFromHand()
        * Selects the Tile that the player wants to play.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the Tile that the player wants to play

      • showHand

        public void showHand(SetOfTiles hand)
        Shows the current tiles that the player has on their hand.
        Parameters:
        hand - a SetOfTiles representing the player's tiles that has to play.

      • playerIsPlaying

        public void playerIsPlaying(java.lang.String p)
        Shows which player is playing. Bot is called Player 0.
        Parameters:

      • pickDominoTypeToPlay

        public static int pickDominoTypeToPlay()
        Shows main menu and returns the type of DominoGame user wants to play(as an integer).
        Returns:
        1 for Solo1,2 for Hungarian,3 for Cardinal

      • askName

        public java.lang.String askName()
        Asks name of User.
        Returns:
        String representing name of User.
